Summary: Orange Pulse-like object 4-5 dots streak off, not to ground but up and away!
trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Dillsburg
There were no other sightings in Dillsburg on or around December 9th 2009
divs: sighting detailsdecember 9th, 2009 ok. i saw a ufo tonight, rather, this morning. i was going for one last pee for my dog and just as i went out from my side garage door i looked upward. as i was going out, the stars on the horizon of my field of vision were so bright and clear i could already see i wanted to look at them when i stepped out. i poked my head from out of the threshold of my garage and as i looked up i saw a distinct orange streak; pulse-like, four or five dots, but very clear, then abruptly disappear. the last dots were longer than the first ones. this was not a meteorite i witnessed! it was very large and moving at an incredible rate of speed. there were clouds in the sky, but this light was not obfuscated by them in the least. orange...pulse-like and then....poof....gone. meteorites and meteorite showers have a trace. we've all seen them and can watch them burn across the sky. they're beautiful and fascinating and they burn bright white. clouds will either dim or completely kill your line of sight. what i saw was bright orange and had a distinct ...bam....bam...bam...pulse....as it just whipped across the night sky. again, meteorites have a type of arc; they're somewhat predictable. what i just saw wasn't going down! it wasn't "going across!" what i just saw was going up and out! it was going away from earth...at a very high rate of speed. again, i stress, i've been looking at the night sky for decades. i'm not an astronomer; just a regular guy who enjoys the sight of stars and the occasional meteorite. this is something i've never seen before and will never forget for the rest of my life. the memory of this was that it was most impressive and very frightening. it wasn't a meteorite. meteorites don't pulse like that and i'd really like to hear a phd. in astrophysics explain why that damn thing was bright orange! in all sincerity, i swear this is what i witnessed today. [cms\tg\pid]
